TopicTitle: R-14 Mischief Rocket - Stock KSP Weaponry

Articles.Content:
Greetings!

Here is a quick demonstration video of the R-14 Mischief Rocket. The weapon is very basic, but efficient. It's supersonic and very accurate, but short-ranged. In this video, the weapon is deployed from a Guzworks A-5 Dagger. Enjoy!

Greetings!

Here is a quick demonstration video of the R-14 Mischief Rocket. The weapon is very basic, but efficient. It's supersonic and very accurate, but short-ranged. In this video, the weapon is deployed from a Guzworks A-5 Dagger. Enjoy!

http://youtu.be/sJJTMAO1bwg

Great video! Quick question though, what do you use to record. I'm looking for a better software.

Thanks Jack. I think I am going to also do a Spacecraft Exchange post for specifications and pictures instead of video.

Some months ago I bit the bullet and purchased FRAPS. Haven't regretted it since. Very nice quality, but be warned: you NEED a lot of disk space for this. The videos it makes with the raw screen caps are very nice, but come out to 50 - 100GB+ EACH, even for just 30s - 1m of video... Thankfully there is such a thing as terabyte HDDs for relatively cheap. For editing, I just use Windows Movie Maker. It's somewhat basic, but you can do quite a bit with it.
